channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023110365
item.description:
Report X-2023110365

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: MESA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT IN THE PRELOAD OPERATION. WEARING THE APPROPRIATE PPE DOMINIC COLORAD, THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WENT TO THE LOCATION OF THE SPILL FOR CLEAN UP. PLACING THE LEAKER IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND UTILIZING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. THE RESPONDER THEN RETURNED WITH THE PACKAGE/DEBRIS TO THE DAMAGE CAGE FOR FURTHER INSPECTION.

item.title: Report X-2023100891
item.description:
Report X-2023100891

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND INSIDE OF VAN WITH THE BOX OPEN AND THE BOTTOM OF THE BUCKET SPLIT CAUSING THE POWDERED CHLORINE TO SPILL IN VAN. DescribePack: THE BOOTOM OF THE 5GAL PLASTIC BUCKET APPEARED TO BUST OPEN AT THE SEAMS AS IF TOO FULL. THE CHLORINE WAS IN A PLASTIC BAG AND TORN OPEN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE CHLORINE WAS SWEPT UP AND EVERYTHING WAS PLACED IN A PLASTIC HAZMAT BAGAND THEN PLACED IN A HAZMAT TOTE. EVERYTHING WAS THEN MOVED TO THE QA REPACK STATION.

item.title: Report X-2023100836
item.description:
Report X-2023100836

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the unload and leaking its oxidizing slightly corrosive material DescribePack: The failure was the package was slightly crushed, making the bottle leak its contents from being crushed and damaging the box DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was very slowly moved as not to shake the damaged bottle

item.title: Report X-2023100830
item.description:
Report X-2023100830

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was brought from the unload area wet due to one bottle of liquid having a loose top leaked damaging the outer packaging DescribePack: one of the bottles had a loose top DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the top was tightened down and the package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote and brought to QA

item.title: Report X-2023100657

Report X-2023100657

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was coming from the tail end of the trailer when it was discovered to be wet. the package was taken directly to the QA hut for inspection. DescribePack: the top of one of the plastic gallon containers came off during shipping DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote and brought to QA

item.title: Report I-2023100051
item.description:
Report I-2023100051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: Phoenix
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/13/2023 hidden dangerous goods were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL PHX Service Center, 2350 E Riverview Drive Suite 100, Phoenix, AZ 85034. Transportation by road confirmed. Shipment also contains UN1950 Aerosols, flammable Class 2.1 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Receptacle Material ofConstruction: Metal f Package Capacity: 43 g Amount in Package: 43 g Number in Shipment 1 Number Failed: 1

item.title: Report X-2023100434
item.description:
Report X-2023100434

  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Sept 11th a package was discovered during the AM sort that showed signs of leaking. The package contained UN1245, Methyl Isobutyl Ketone, 3, II. The spill was cleaned up and the package placed into a salvage drum and the consignee was contacted to come and pick it up.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the station 869's day sort to package handlers had gotten some of the hydrogen peroxide liquid on there hands and slight chemical burn DescribePack: there are small holes underneath the cap causing the liquid to leak out DurationRel: 20 and MitigateEffect: The Jerry Can was set upright so no more contents could leak

item.title: Report X-2023100569

Report X-2023100569

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THIS PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN THE UNLOAD WET AND LEAKING I WAS CALLED TO ASSEST THE PACKAGE AND CLEAN UP THE AREA DescribePack: THE FAILURE HAPPENED DUE TO A LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WHEN I GOT TO THE AREA, I PUT ABSORBANT OBVER THE WET AREA PLACE THE PACKAGE INTO A TOTE TO PREVENT FURTHER CONTAMINATION

item.title: Report X-2023100318
item.description:
Report X-2023100318

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-25
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During unload package was discovered in front of van wet. Package was place in Hazmat plastic bag then placed in a hazmat tote and removed from area. DescribePack: The plastic cap was found loose with the seal missing causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package and contents was place in Hazmat plastic bag then placed in a hazmat tote and moved to QA area.

item.title: Report X-2023100302
item.description:
Report X-2023100302

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and placed into a hazmat bag to be taken to QA hut to be processed. DescribePack: The lids have loose caps which caused the liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a white pail and placed into hazmat cage waiting for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023100264
item.description:
Report X-2023100264

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unload brought package to QA wet. Package was placed in a hazmat bag. Upon inspection it was discovered the lid on container was loose causing a small amount to leak out of packaging. DescribePack: Small amount were leaking out of cap on top of bag. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a hazmat lined tote and proper PPE tools and supplies were used in securing hazmat.
